meanings.definition: A docile horse, especially one used for riding.
meanings.sent1: The palfrey trotted gently along the trail, carrying its rider with ease.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed her leisurely rides on the palfrey through the peaceful countryside.
meanings.sent3: The palfrey seemed to wink at the other horses, knowing it was the favorite among riders.
meanings.sent4: Her palfrey was a loyal companion, always ready to take her on new adventures.
meanings.sent5: Children in the village loved to watch the graceful palfrey prance in the meadow.

meanings.sent1: The elegant palfrey carried the lady in her finest dress to the royal event.
meanings.sent2: In medieval times, a lady's status was often reflected in the quality of her palfrey.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous palfrey nuzzled the lady's hat off her head, causing laughter all around.
meanings.sent4: Her palfrey was her trusted companion, understanding her every mood and need.
meanings.sent5: The palfrey's gentle eyes mirrored the kindness of its rider, creating a perfect pair.
